intro: Myriophyllum gracile, commonly known as water milfoil, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often submerged in water, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically emerging from the water's surface. Myriophyllum gracile is an aquatic or semi-aquatic plant, often found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to aquatic life.
